item.title: Intrusion Detection System
item.description:
The project started at the time when everyone was shut in their homes, owing to the worldwide pandemic. This was done as a part of Seasons of Code (SOC) organised by Web and Coding Club (WnCC), IIT Bombay. I co-ordinated in a team of 8, to build a real-time system that monitors network traffic for malicious activity. This was done with the help of raw network packet sniffer with a machine learning model detecting threats in the background.

My Contributions:

  • My major work was related to supervising the first year students and building a machine learning model to detect threats. For this, I read many reasearch papers to find out which type of model performs best and which dataset to use.
  • We finally chose CICIDS2017 dataset as this was quite recent and relevant. I then applied Pearson Correlation and Chi-square test to this dataset to select best 15 out of 81 features.
  • I trained the chosen features with an ensemble model (consisting of classifiers such as Random-Forest, ExtraTrees, KNN, etc.) to achieve around 99% accuracy but the model was slow in making predictions and was practically not possible to use it.
  • Then I trained with each of the classifiers and found that KNN and ExtraTrees gave that accuracy to the ensemble model and the delay was mainly because of KNN.
  • Finally using ExtraTrees classifier, I achieved an accuracy of 99.7%, and with greatly reduced inference time.
